column4: I need to create a block device for my new partition, but I don't know major/minor numbers - how do I proceed?
may i ask "why" you feel you need to create a device node ?
Because when IC reated the partition, it won't let me format it, says can't stat device
and what device are you trying to access ?
mke2fs -j /dev/rd/c0d0p8
reason i'm asking, udevd is supposed to take care of device node creation
I tried restarting udevd but it didn't create it
what is this hardware ?
It's a Mylex 170 Acceleraid.  RAID 0+1, 1 logical Drive... and this is the last logical drive in the extended partition
All the other devices are ok, but they were creatd during the install of the OS
Incidentally, it' 8.04 server
pastebin  ls -lh /dev/rd/ #and we will see if we can figure out the major/minor for you
http://paste.ubuntu.com/108426/  but it doesn't show the device I need (/dev/rd/c0d0p8)

the command would look something like;  sudo mknod /dev/rd/c0d0p8 b 48 8  # but i'm not sure that will help you any, because; you seem to be trying to use an unsupported number there.  i.e. 48 8 is c0d1 not c0d0p8   so error.  i dont have an answer. sorry.
Thank you for looking.  As I don't have any other disk, would it hurt if I removed the c0d1 block device, and used it's major/minor for the one I want?
only 8 partitions/logical volumes supported  you wont have to remove the other to test.  you can create a false device node without hosing others
thank you for your help
example of false device node: sudo mknod /dev/boohoohoo b 8 1  # < that will actually access sda1
Ah - cool!  ;)
welcome,  and sorry i don't have any experance with raid arrays so can't be more help there.
Problems with blockfile not being there... resolved

It seems the Ubuntu installer only creates an extended partition large enough to hold the logical drives you define during installation.  I thought the extended partiton covered the entire disk - it didn't, so I created the partition as primary, and it's all worked now - thank you ;)
